comment.text: Installed without issue and successfully rain validation container that includes cuda code.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-25040 singularity: Insecure Permissions on temporary directories

long_desc.thetext:
Sylabs Singularity through 3.6.2 has Insecure Permissions on temporary directories used in explicit and implicit container build operations, a different vulnerability than CVE-2020-25039.

Reference:

https://github.com/hpcng/singularity/security/advisories/GHSA-jv9c-w74q-6762

Created singularity tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1882334]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1882333]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-25039 singularity: Insecure Permissions on temporary directories

long_desc.thetext:
Sylabs Singularity 3.2.0 through 3.6.2 has Insecure Permissions on temporary directories used in fakeroot or user namespace container execution.

Reference:

https://github.com/hpcng/singularity/security/advisories/GHSA-w6v2-qchm-grj

Created singularity tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1882337]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1882336]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

singularity-3.6.3 is available:
  https://github.com/hpcng/singularity/releases/tag/v3.6.3

It includes fixes for moderate security vulnerabilities.

I'm not sure why Upstream Release Monitoring didn't automatically create a bug, so I'm doing it manually.
